paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the N588K mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with Short QT Syndrome and its implications for atrial fibrillation.

patients.phenotype: Short QT syndrome variant 1 (SQT1) with atrial fibrillation

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Propafenone has been reported to be effective at preventing recurrent episodes of (paroxysmal) AF mediated by the N588K mutation to hERG.
Propafenone has been reported to be effective at preventing recurrent episodes of (paroxysmal) AF mediated by the N588K mutation to hERG.

functional_data.summary: The N588K mutation leads to a gain-of-function effect, shortening the action potential duration and increasing susceptibility to atrial fibrillation.

variants.segregation_data: The N588K variant segregates with disease in affected probands.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the need for further investigation into the mechanisms of SQT1-related AF.
key_quotes: The N588K mutation to the human Ether-à-go-go-Related gene (hERG) underlies a form of SQTS variant 1 (SQT1) and has been associated with a high incidence of AF in affected probands—as high as 50%.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant variant was clearly mentioned in the text.
